eg.syntax

Class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.syntax.SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
  • Enclosing class:
    SyntaxHighlighter

    public class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The search and highlighting of text elements

    • Method Detail

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(int condition)
        Sets a condition for validating a text element. The condition is passed to Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) when a text element is found.
        Parameters:
        condition - a freely chosen integer. Default is 0

      • setEntireText

        public void setEntireText()
        Sets the section that is simply the entire text

      • setStatementSection

        public void setStatementSection()
        Sets the section that takes into account semicolon separated statements which may be multiline. The search for the next semicolon relative to the current change position continues until one is found unquoted and Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true. The section may be further exdended to the region that contains quote marks around the statement.

      • setMarkupSection

        public void setMarkupSection()
        Sets the section that takes into account markup language tags

      • resetAttributes

        public void resetAttributes()
        Resets the attributes in the section that is to be highlighted

      • keywords

        public void keywords(java.lang.String[] keys,
                     boolean reqWord,
                     char[] nonWordStart,
                     javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights keywords.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - the boolean value that is true to require that keywords are whole words
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that must not precede the keyword. Can be null and is ignored if reqWord is false
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • keywordsIgnoreCase

        public void keywordsIgnoreCase(java.lang.String[] keys,
                               boolean reqWord,
                               char[] nonWordStart,
                               javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights keywords without case sensitivity.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - true to require that keywords are whole words
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that must not precede the keyword. Can be null and is ignored if reqWord is false
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • extensibleKeyword

        public void extensibleKeyword(java.lang.String base,
                              java.lang.String[] extensions,
                              char[] nonWordStart,
                              javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights an extensible base keyword.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        base - the base keyword
        extensions - the array of keywords that may extend base
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that must not precede the keyword in addition to digits and letters. Can be null
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • signedVariables

        public void signedVariables(char[] signs,
                            char[] endMarks,
                            char[] successors,
                            javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights variables that one of the specified signs precedes.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        signs - the signs for the start of the variables
        endMarks - the marks for the end of the variables
        successors - the characters that disable endMarks if they directly follow a sign
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the variables

      • signedVariable

        public void signedVariable(char sign,
                           char[] endMarks,
                           char[] successors,
                           javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights a variable that the specified sign precedes.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        sign - the sign for the start of the variable
        endMarks - the marks for the end of the variable
        successors - the characters that disable endMarks if they directly follow the sign
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the variables

      • braces

        public void braces()
        Searches and highlights opening and closing braces in blue and bold.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)

      • brackets

        public void brackets()
        Searches and highlights opening and closing brackets in blue and bold.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)

      • quote

        public void quote()
        Searches and highlights quoted text in single or double quotation marks in orange.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)

      • quoteInLine

        public void quoteInLine()
        Searches and highlights quoted text in single or double quotation marks in orange whereby a quotation must be found inside a line.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)

      • markup

        public void markup(boolean html)
        Searches and highlights markup elements. Tag names are shown in blue, attributes in red and quoted attribute values in purple.
        Parameters:
        html - true for html, false for xml

      • innerHtmlSections

        public void innerHtmlSections(java.lang.String startTag,
                              java.lang.String endTag,
                              boolean reqClosingBracket,
                              Highlighter hlSection)
        Searches sections in an html document where text elements are highlighted with a temporary Highlighter
        Parameters:
        startTag - the start tag without closing bracket
        endTag - the end tag
        reqClosingBracket - true if the start tag needs a closing bracket; false otherwise
        hlSection - the Highlighter

      • lineComments

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String lineCmntStart)
        Searches and highlights line comments in green.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        lineCmntStart - the line comment start

      • isInBlock

        public boolean isInBlock(java.lang.String blockStart,
                         java.lang.String blockEnd,
                         int quoteOpt)
        Returns if the position where a change happened is found inside a block
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the block comment start
        blockEnd - the block comment end
        quoteOpt - the option to define if matches in quotes are skipped: INCLUDE_QUOTED, SKIP_QUOTED, SKIP_LINE_QUOTED in SyntaxUtils
        Returns:
        true if inside a block comment; false otherwise. Also false regardless of the position if the text change is multiline

      • block

        public void block(java.lang.String blockStart,
                  java.lang.String blockEnd,
                  int quoteOpt)
        Searches and highlights a block in green
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the block start
        blockEnd - the block end
        quoteOpt - the option to define if matches in quotes are skipped: INCLUDE_QUOTED, SKIP_QUOTED, SKIP_LINE_QUOTED in SyntaxUtils
